item.title: Locke & Key: Season 2
item.description:
Daaang things escalated. We’ve got more history, more direct interactions with the demons (and slight humanization to them, which is an interesting choice), and more character building with both the family and those around it. Man, I just want to give them all a big hug.

I so very look forward to Season 3! (see the end)

item.title: Locke & Key: Season 1
item.description:
I really enjoyed the Locke & Key graphic novels, so of course I had to give the TV show a try. Turns out: also really good. While they changed a few things with the details of how the keys worked that are probably more efficient to do in TV (not opening the tops of people’s heads for instance), it’s still got the same wonderfully creepy dark magical vibe. I do love the actors–Bode in particular does his part very well, as do his siblings.

Man that’s a crazy show. Well worth the show (warning, it is dark, although not overly graphic). On to season 2!

item.title: Locke & Key, Vol. 5: Clockworks
item.description:
Another volume, another Key. This time, the ability to travel in time! Albeit only to view what’s going on. But given how many mysteries there are in this house and this family… that’s more than enough.

It’s really interesting going back to the time of the Revolutionary War and the origins of the Locke family and the keys.

item.title: Locke & Key, Vol. 3: Crown of Shadows
item.description: So it’s not just keys… it’s crowns and other artifacts too now? That’s cool! They’re all still vaguely key related, so it works out.

item.title: Locke & Key, Vol. 2: Head Games
item.description: Okay last time around, we were introduced to Keyhose, to the Well (and the creepy denizen thereof). Nice and creepy. But of course, this time around, we have to go a few levels further…
